definition: to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
five/5
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Jack is totally in love with his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 杰克爱他的女友爱得五体投地。

sentences.english: I can put their cursing, you can also get extremely admire.
sentences.chinese: 我可以把自己骂死，也可以把你自责得五体投地。

sentences.english: We're all beside ourselves with admiration for you.
sentences.chinese: 我们大家对你佩服得五体投地。

sentences.english: The comedian really knocked the audience dead .
sentences.chinese: 那位喜剧演员真是使观众五体投地。

sentences.english: He was rapt in admiration of that young lady.
sentences.chinese: 他对这位少女真是崇拜得五体投地。

sentences.english: And that is a very key factor for me that I am kind of …you know… I get a weak knee when I see a customer-obsessing company.
sentences.chinese: 只要看到以客户为中心的公司时我就佩服得五体投地。

sentences.english: He fell all over his own father.
sentences.chinese: 他对自己的父亲崇拜得五体投地。

sentences.english: As long as you succeed they are yours entirely.
sentences.chinese: 只要你胜利了，他们就对你五体投地。

sentences.english: The lead speaker brought the audience to its feet with his wit.
sentences.chinese: 该名主要发言人让听众对他的智慧佩服得五体投地。

sentences.english: He spoke highly of the novel. He almost worshipped the ground the author trod on.
sentences.chinese: 他高度赞赏这部小说，他对作者简直崇拜得五体投地。

sentences.english: Mary admires John from the bottom of her heart.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽对约翰佩服得五体投地。

to kowtow/to kneel and worship
to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom)/(fig.) to worship/to bow down to
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others

to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
(to gasp) with admiration
